definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: New blood seems to be coursing through your veins and you are changing as a result.
sentences.chinese: 新血似乎是通過您的靜脈竊喜，你因此而改變。

sentences.english: They were secretly delighted at his embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 對於他的尷尬，他們暗自竊喜。

sentences.english: You may be a little relieved that, for once, you're not the one arguing with a parent.
sentences.chinese: 也許你會竊喜，你沒有因爲其中的事情和父母爭吵過。
撒旦竊喜說，“那間人人都想要。”

sentences.english: Secretly congratulating himself on his good luck, Andy pocketed the money and proceeded to walk away.
sentences.chinese: 安迪暗自竊喜，把錢塞進口袋裏後準備離開。

sentences.english: They then get undigested food protein coursing through the small bowel.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他們可以通過小腸的未消化食物蛋白質竊喜。

definition: overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
as if relieved from a burden (idiom)/to have a weight off one's mind
